intro: Eriogonum nervulosum, commonly known as the nervy buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its distinctive leaf venation and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, such as hillsides and grasslands. Its leaves are narrow and have prominent nerves, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Eriogonum nervulosum is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
